Overview  Service   Command 

Service: zimbraMail
Namespace: "urn:zimbraMail"
DestroyWaitSet SOAP Command

Use this to close out the waitset. Note that the server will automatically time out a wait set if there is no reference to it for (default of) 20 minutes.

WaitSet: scalable mechanism for listening for changes to one or more accounts

Authorization token required true
Admin Authorization token required false

DestroyWaitSetRequest

    <DestroyWaitSetRequest waitSet="{waitset-id}" /> ## DestroyWaitSetRequest

The following table describes elements and attributes you can define within a <DestroyWaitSetRequest> element:

XPath Required / Optional Description
@waitSet Required (only 1) Type:String
Waitset ID

DestroyWaitSetResponse

    <DestroyWaitSetResponse waitSet="{waitset-id}" /> ## DestroyWaitSetResponse

The following table describes elements and attributes you can define within a <DestroyWaitSetResponse> element:

XPath Required / Optional Description
@waitSet Required (only 1) Type:String
WaitSet ID
